<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/bitcoin-tops-50000?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bitcoin Hits $0.00005 Billion
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/bitcoin-tops-50000" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bitcoin as dollars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDcyL2JpdGNvaW5fYXNfZG9sbGFycy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twelve years ago, bitcoin was just an idea. Now, it’s worth as much as a tiny house.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the world’s largest cryptocurrency briefly surpassed $50,000 for the first time ever, extending a run that’s mesmerized the business world and frustrated your friend who sold all their bitcoin in 2019. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A brief timeline of bitcoin’s rise, fall, and even bigger rise.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2008: </strong>Satoshi Nakamoto published the bitcoin <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-the-bitcoin-white-paper?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">white paper</a> that laid out the principles of a "new electronic cash system that's fully peer-to-peer, with no trusted third party." To this day, one knows who (or what group of people) Satoshi is.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2010: </strong>A programmer bought <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-pizza-day-celebrating-pizza-bought-10000-btc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two pizzas</a> for 10,000 bitcoin in what will go down as the most expensive pizza transaction ever. Let's just assume there were 16 slices between the two pies and you take 15 bites per slice—at today's bitcoin price, that's about $2 million per bite.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2017: </strong>JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon called bitcoin a "<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/20/jp-morgan-ceo-jamie-dimon-in-2017-calls-bitcoin-a-fraud.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fraud</a>" (a comment he later walked back).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2018: </strong>The NYT ran an article with the headline, "<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/13/style/bitcoin-millionaires.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Everyone is getting hilariously rich and you're not</a>" after bitcoin jumped from $830 to $19,300 in the span of one year. Things stopped being quite so hilarious later in 2018, when bitcoin crashed to $3,200. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2020–2021: </strong>After hovering below $10,000 for months, bitcoin refueled its rocket ship. It's already up about 75% this year alone.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's next? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Initially conceived as a way of sidestepping traditional financial institutions, bitcoin is now being smothered by them. BNY Mellon, the oldest bank in the US, said it would handle bitcoin for its clients. Mastercard pledged to support cryptos later this year. And a vaunted Morgan Stanley investing unit is reportedly considering <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-13/morgan-stanley-may-bet-on-bitcoin-in-150-billion-investment-arm?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">placing bets</a> on bitcoin.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, Tesla poured </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/08/tesla-buys-15-billion-worth-bitcoin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.5 billion of its cash</a></span><span> into bitcoin and said it would accept payment for its products in bitcoin on a limited basis.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Bitcoin has been increasingly legitimized by the business community, but it still faces existential questions, including 1) how should it be regulated? 2) what is it actually useful for? and 3) when will Morning Brew put it in its Markets graphic?  </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/snowstorm-unexpectedly-freezes-us-businesses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Deep Freeze Causes Power Emergency in Texas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A truck plowing snow " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDcxL3RydWNrX3Nub3cuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ron Jenkins/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A fearsome storm continued to roll through the south and central US yesterday, leaving millions of households without power in bone-chilling temperatures. At least 20 people have died in the storm or its aftermath. As for businesses…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Power and gas outages </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-deep-freeze-companies/companies-forced-to-halt-operations-as-freeze-grips-parts-of-united-states-idUSKBN2AG1RI?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forced</a></span><span> GM, Toyota, and Nissan to suspend operations at some plants. Poultry producer Sanderson Farms did the same at processing plants in Texas, Mississippi, and Louisiana. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Airlines have </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/16/texas-winter-storm-prompts-hundreds-of-flight-cancellations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">had to cancel</a></span><span> over 4,000 Texas flights since Monday. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>US oil output fell by a record one-third.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Walmart and other retailers temporarily closed their stores in the region.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The storm also snarled coronavirus vaccine rollout efforts. Some authorities in Texas had to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-weather/texas-deep-freeze-leaves-millions-without-power-some-snowboarding-behind-pickups-idUSKBN2AG257?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rush doses</a> into people’s arms before they spoiled. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The blame game has kicked into high gear about what exactly caused the power crisis in Texas. Here are three reads to help understand the situation: 1) Why Texas has its <a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2011/02/08/texplainer-why-does-texas-have-its-own-power-grid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">own power grid</a>, 2) what happened to <a href="https://arstechnica.com/science/2021/02/texas-power-grid-crumples-under-the-cold/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">power generation</a> during the cold snap, and 3) how the <a href="https://www.epa.gov/greenpower/us-electricity-grid-markets?s=09&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">US electricity grid works</a> in general. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/goldman-sachs-debuts-consumer-investing-product-marcus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zuckerberg, Wahlberg, Cuban: Here's Another Mark to Know
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, white-shoe bank Goldman Sachs <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-consumer-banking-idINKBN2AG168?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a> its new consumer investing product, Marcus Invest, which is available to customers in shoes of any color. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As long as those shoes have at least $1,000. That's the minimum amount users need to invest in Marcus, at a 0.35% annual fee. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works:</strong> The app quizzes you on your risk tolerance, then guides your deposit through models developed by the bank's investment strategy arm.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Previously, to get access to Goldman's sage wealth management advice, you needed at least $10 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Marcus Invest is part of CEO David Solomon's campaign to steer Goldman away from the choppier trading and investment banking sectors and toward the safer shores of consumer banking, which offers more consistent, recurring revenue. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out, again: </strong>Marcus Invest also represents Goldman's first venture into "robo-advising," a sector popularized by Wealthfront and Betterment that's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-to-offer-its-investing-know-how-to-the-masses-11613471402?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated to reach</a> $449 billion this year, per Cerulli Associates. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Athletic Greens" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTQ0MC8xNjEyNzk3NDM1LTE2MDg1OTA3MzEtMTYwNjkzODc3MC0xNjA1MjIwNjEwLU1vcm5pbmdCcmV3XzE0NDB4NzAwXzMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">

<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s green. It’s tasty. It’s quite possibly the most nutrient-dense nutritional beverage on the planet. And it’s aptly named <a href="https://athleticgreens.com/partner/d35ctoffer-nutrition/us?aff_id=1033&offer_id=27&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=publisher&utm_campaign=morningbrew_d35ct_021721__a1033__o27&utm_term=cac&utm_content=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Athletic Greens</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Athletic Greens is like <a href="https://athleticgreens.com/partner/d35ctoffer-nutrition/us?aff_id=1033&offer_id=27&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=publisher&utm_campaign=morningbrew_d35ct_021721__a1033__o27&utm_term=cac&utm_content=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">insurance for the most important thing you’ve got</a>—your bod. <strong style="color:#000">Just one scoop of Athletic Greens packs in 75 vitamins, minerals, and whole food-sourced ingredients. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you sip on this scoop, you’re not<em> just</em> sipping on <strong style="color:#000">a multivitamin, multimineral, probiotic, greens superfood blend</strong>. You’re also filling the nutritional gaps in your diet, increasing energy and focus, aiding digestion, and supporting a healthy immune system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The best part? To get the number one nutritional insurance in the universe, you don’t even have to speak with an insurance agent. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you want to simplify your nutrition routine into one easy habit, you gotta try Athletic Greens today—they’ll even throw in a <a href="https://athleticgreens.com/partner/d35ctoffer-nutrition/us?aff_id=1033&offer_id=27&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=publisher&utm_campaign=morningbrew_d35ct_021721__a1033__o27&utm_term=cac&utm_content=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">free year's supply of vitamin D and 5 free travel packs</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/marriott-ceo-arne-sorenson-passes-away?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Hotel Icon Dies at 62
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, Marriott President and CEO Arne Sorenson died following a nearly two-year battle with pancreatic cancer. <a href="https://twitter.com/satyanadella/status/1361714826154708992?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Remembered</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/Benioff/status/1361759216130658304?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">by</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/rafat/status/1361692720247549957?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">many</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/bchesky/status/1361729210339840000?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as</a> a humble and kind leader, Sorenson made Marriott the world's biggest hotel chain.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He left Big Law in 1996 and joined Marriott, where he <a href="https://thepointsguy.com/news/remembering-marriotts-arne-sorenson/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose through the ranks</a> from associate general counsel to CFO, COO, and president. In 2012, he became the company's third CEO—and the first without the surname Marriott. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"> 
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sorenson led the $13.6 billion acquisition of Starwood Hotels in 2016 and unified loyalty brands under Marriott Bonvoy in 2019.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-56088817?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">steered</a></span><span> the company through crises including the Covid-19 pandemic and a massive data breach that exposed 300+ million customers' data.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sorenson also used his position to speak out on issues around immigration and LGBTQ discrimination. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During his tenure, Marriott's stock rose over 240%. The $42 billion company he leaves behind will name a successor by the end of the month.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/b2b-b2c-d2c-mean?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Question: Finding Your Fulfillment
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="E-comm deliveries pile up on a doorstep" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTE2L29ubGluZV9kZWxpdmVyeV9waWxlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Wednesday, we answer a reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Got something to ask us? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Do it here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">From Julia R. in Waltham, MA:</strong> Can you explain the difference between B2C and B2B?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew's answer:</strong> Great question, let's try on our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Retail Brew</a> hat and see if it still fits. B2B, B2C, and their cousin D2C (also styled DTC) are all frameworks used to identify a company's typical customer.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In </span><span><strong style="color:#000">business-to-business</strong></span><span> (B2B), the product is for a corporate customer. Think Salesforce.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In </span><span><strong style="color:#000">business-to-consumer </strong></span><span>(B2C), a manufacturer sells to individuals but a retailer or distributor may sit in the middle, like this </span><span><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Anker-Wireless-Vertical-Ergonomic-Optical/dp/B00BIFNTMC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ergonomic mouse</a></span><span> you bought through Amazon or the Burt's Bees lip balm you picked up at a local drugstore. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In </span><span><strong style="color:#000">direct-to-consumer</strong></span><span>, a subset of B2C, companies like Warby Parker or Away send their products straight to you.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We've gotten many questions about acronyms, so to make it easy we compiled this <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/business-acronyms-know-f0b5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">master guide</a> of the confusing ones that show up most often in the Brew.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwelve years ago, bitcoin was just an idea. Now, it’s worth as much as a tiny house.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the world’s largest cryptocurrency briefly surpassed $50,000 for the first time ever, extending a run that’s mesmerized the business world and frustrated your friend who sold all their bitcoin in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA brief timeline of bitcoin’s rise, fall, and even bigger rise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2008: \u003c/strong\u003eSatoshi Nakamoto published the bitcoin \u003ca href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-the-bitcoin-white-paper?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhite paper\u003c/a\u003e that laid out the principles of a \"new electronic cash system that's fully peer-to-peer, with no trusted third party.\" To this day, one knows who (or what group of people) Satoshi is.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2010: \u003c/strong\u003eA programmer bought \u003ca href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-pizza-day-celebrating-pizza-bought-10000-btc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo pizzas\u003c/a\u003e for 10,000 bitcoin in what will go down as the most expensive pizza transaction ever. Let's just assume there were 16 slices between the two pies and you take 15 bites per slice—at today's bitcoin price, that's about $2 million per bite.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2017: \u003c/strong\u003eJPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon called bitcoin a \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/20/jp-morgan-ceo-jamie-dimon-in-2017-calls-bitcoin-a-fraud.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efraud\u003c/a\u003e\" (a comment he later walked back).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2018: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NYT ran an article with the headline, \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/13/style/bitcoin-millionaires.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eEveryone is getting hilariously rich and you're not\u003c/a\u003e\" after bitcoin jumped from $830 to $19,300 in the span of one year. Things stopped being quite so hilarious later in 2018, when bitcoin crashed to $3,200. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2020–2021: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter hovering below $10,000 for months, bitcoin refueled its rocket ship. It's already up about 75% this year alone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's next? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInitially conceived as a way of sidestepping traditional financial institutions, bitcoin is now being smothered by them. BNY Mellon, the oldest bank in the US, said it would handle bitcoin for its clients. Mastercard pledged to support cryptos later this year. And a vaunted Morgan Stanley investing unit is reportedly considering \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-13/morgan-stanley-may-bet-on-bitcoin-in-150-billion-investment-arm?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplacing bets\u003c/a\u003e on bitcoin.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, Tesla poured \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/08/tesla-buys-15-billion-worth-bitcoin?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.5 billion of its cash\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e into bitcoin and said it would accept payment for its products in bitcoin on a limited basis.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBitcoin has been increasingly legitimized by the business community, but it still faces existential questions, including 1) how should it be regulated? 2) what is it actually useful for? and 3) when will Morning Brew put it in its Markets collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA fearsome storm continued to roll through the south and central US yesterday, leaving millions of households without power in bone-chilling temperatures. At least 20 people have died in the storm or its aftermath. As for businesses…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePower and gas outages \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-deep-freeze-companies/companies-forced-to-halt-operations-as-freeze-grips-parts-of-united-states-idUSKBN2AG1RI?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e GM, Toyota, and Nissan to suspend operations at some plants. Poultry producer Sanderson Farms did the same at processing plants in Texas, Mississippi, and Louisiana. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAirlines have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/16/texas-winter-storm-prompts-hundreds-of-flight-cancellations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehad to cancel\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e over 4,000 Texas flights since Monday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUS oil output fell by a record one-third.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWalmart and other retailers temporarily closed their stores in the region.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe storm also snarled coronavirus vaccine rollout efforts. Some authorities in Texas had to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-weather/texas-deep-freeze-leaves-millions-without-power-some-snowboarding-behind-pickups-idUSKBN2AG257?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erush doses\u003c/a\u003e into people’s arms before they spoiled. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe blame game has kicked into high gear about what exactly caused the power crisis in Texas. Here are three reads to help understand the situation: 1) Why Texas has its \u003ca href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2011/02/08/texplainer-why-does-texas-have-its-own-power-grid/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eown power grid\u003c/a\u003e, 2) what happened to \u003ca #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epower generation\u003c/a\u003e during the cold snap, and 3) how the \u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, white-shoe bank Goldman Sachs \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-consumer-banking-idINKBN2AG168?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolled out\u003c/a\u003e its new consumer investing product, Marcus Invest, which is available to customers in shoes of any color. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs long as those shoes have at least $1,000. That's the minimum amount users need to invest in Marcus, at a 0.35% annual fee. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works:\u003c/strong\u003e The app quizzes you on your risk tolerance, then guides your deposit through models developed by the bank's investment strategy arm.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePreviously, to get access to Goldman's sage wealth management advice, you needed at least $10 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMarcus Invest is part of CEO David Solomon's campaign to steer Goldman away from the choppier trading and investment banking sectors and toward the safer shores of consumer banking, which offers more consistent, recurring revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out, again: \u003c/strong\u003eMarcus Invest also represents Goldman's first venture into \"robo-advising,\" a sector popularized by Wealthfront and Betterment that's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-to-offer-its-investing-know-how-to-the-masses-11613471402?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated to reach\u003c/a\u003e $449 billion this year, per Cerulli Associates. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, Marriott President and CEO Arne Sorenson died following a nearly two-year battle with pancreatic cancer. \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/satyanadella/status/1361714826154708992?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRemembered\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Benioff/status/1361759216130658304?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eby\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/rafat/status/1361692720247549957?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emany\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/bchesky/status/1361729210339840000?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas\u003c/a\u003e a humble and kind leader, Sorenson made Marriott the world's biggest hotel chain.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe left Big Law in 1996 and joined Marriott, where he \u003ca href=\"https://thepointsguy.com/news/remembering-marriotts-arne-sorenson/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose through the ranks\u003c/a\u003e from associate general counsel to CFO, COO, and president. In 2012, he became the company's third CEO—and the first without the surname Marriott. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSorenson led the $13.6 billion acquisition of Starwood Hotels in 2016 and unified loyalty brands under Marriott Bonvoy in 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-56088817?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esteered\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the company through crises including the Covid-19 pandemic and a massive data breach that exposed 300+ million customers' data.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSorenson also used his position to speak out on issues around immigration and LGBTQ discrimination. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring his tenure, Marriott's stock rose over 240%. The $42 billion company he leaves behind will name a successor by the end of the month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Got something to ask us? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eDo it here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrom Julia R. in Waltham, MA:\u003c/strong\u003e Can you explain the difference between B2C and B2B?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew's answer:\u003c/strong\u003e Great question, let's try on our \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRetail Brew\u003c/a\u003e hat and see if it still fits. B2B, B2C, and their cousin D2C (also styled DTC) are all frameworks used to identify a company's typical customer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ebusiness-to-business\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (B2B), the product is for a corporate customer. Think Salesforce.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ebusiness-to-consumer \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e(B2C), a manufacturer sells to individuals but a retailer or distributor may sit in the middle, like this \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Anker-Wireless-Vertical-Ergonomic-Optical/dp/B00BIFNTMC?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eergonomic mouse\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e you bought through Amazon or the Burt's Bees lip balm you picked up at a local drugstore. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003edirect-to-consumer\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a subset of B2C, companies like Warby Parker or Away send their products straight to you.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe've gotten many questions about acronyms, so to make it easy we compiled this \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/16/business-acronyms-know-f0b5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emaster guide\u003c/a\u003e of the confusing ones that show up most often in the
